pageContext.claim: “On the bad side, the D.C. Mayor, @MurielBowser, who is always looking for money & help, wouldn't let the D.C. Police get involved. 'Not their job.' Nice!”
pageContext.analysis: This is false. The Metropolitan Police Department assisted the uniformed Secret Service officers during the May 29 protests. The Secret Service contradicted Trump after his tweet, saying in a statement that "the Metropolitan Police Department and U.S. Park Police were on the scene." Mayor Bowser told reporters that "no one needed to ask the Metropolitan Police Department to get involved because we were already involved. Our police were doing their jobs from the start. D.C. police supported uniformed Secret Service last night like we have done literally dozens of times at Lafayette Park."
